identificationModule.briefTitle: Trial to Investigate the Influence of the Homeopathic Remedy Naja-comp on Stroke Therapy in Geriatric Rehabilitation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Multicenter Randomized Controlled Trial to Investigate the Influence of the Homeopathic Remedy 'Naja-comp' on Stroke Therapy in Geriatric Rehabilitation

responsibleParty.oldOrganization: University of Erlangen-Nuernberg, Institute for Biomedicine of Aging

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The homeopathic remedy 'naja-comp' will improve functional outcome measured by the Barthel-Index.

The homeopathic remedy 'naja-comp' will decrease complications during geriatric rehabilitation measured by rate of unplanned discharge to hospital.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Secondary outcome for functional improvement are Scandinavian Stroke Scale, 4D+S-Scale and Timed-Up\&Go-Test.

armGroups.label: Naja-comp.
armGroups.description: s.c. injection of naja comp (homeopathic remedy) three times a week

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: s.c. injection of placebo (NaCl-solution) three times a week

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: s.c. injection of NaCl-solution three times a week

primaryOutcomes.measure: rate of unplanned discharge to hospital care

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* stroke within 60 days after onset

Exclusion Criteria:

* stroke by injury or tumor
* stroke older than 60 days
* missing consent for participation
* participation at other clinical trials

overallOfficials.name: Cornel Sieber, Professor
overallOfficials.affiliation: Univerity of Erlangen-Nuernberg, Director of the Institute for Biomedicine of Aging
